content: of the head below the horn as shown below fasten_off then use a needle to hide the yarn tail inside the head twist the body to get the limbs into the right positions that s it make a slip_stitch into the back of the head finished dragon minus eyes now using embroidery thread and/or beads give your dragon a face here s the method i use thread a piece of black or contrasting embroidery cotton through a stitch under a nostril bump and make a small knot push the needle back into the head at the same point and pull the thread through to where you want the eye to be thread on a bead or if you want the dragon to be child friendly loop the thread through a couple of stitches a few times to make an embroidered eye push the needle through the head to the opposite side and repeat to make the other eye push the needle back into the head and come out under the other nostril bump make a small knot there will now be a thread tail coming from each nostril- use the needle to hide these inside the head if you wish use a piece of white thread to add a highlight to the top of each eye but feel free to do it your own way and give it some extra character go make some dragons **** pattern by thalia evans this pattern is intended for personal use to make random acts of crochet kindness please give credit where appropriate and do not reuse the photos in this document if you use bead or safety eyes the finished item will not be suitable for children under 3 due to small parts i do not claim credit for the original worry worm which this pattern is based on www woollytea carrd co
